advanced_tcpip_h.intro_Txt: See also the help on the basic TCP/IP settings.
advanced_tcpip_h.obtainDNS_Txt1a: Obtain DNS server address via DHCP - Checking this radio button causes the
advanced_tcpip_h.obtainDNS_Txt1b: to automatically look up and use the DNS server settings as provided by DHCP. Note that this will not be available if using a static IP address. Click the View button to see the current settings.
advanced_tcpip_h.manDNS_Txt1: To make manual settings, check the radio button Use the following DNS server address and then specify the following:
advanced_tcpip_h.manDNS_Txt2a: Domain name - When using a host name that is not fully qualified, enter here the domain(s) in which to search for the host name used by the
advanced_tcpip_h.manDNS_Txt2b: . Multiple domains can be separated by semicolons (;).
advanced_tcpip_h.manDNS_Txt3: Primary DNS server - Enter the IP address of the primary DNS server. This server provides the translation of host names to IP addresses on your network.
advanced_tcpip_h.manDNS_Txt4: Secondary DNS server - Specify the IP address of the secondary DNS server. This will be used if the primary DNS server is unavailable.
advanced_tcpip_h.manDNS_Txt5b: to use DHCP servers for obtaining network settings, it may also be possible for a BOOTP server to provide these settings.
advanced_tcpip_h.obtainNTP_Txt1a: Obtain NTP server address via DHCP - Checking this radio button causes the
advanced_tcpip_h.obtainNTP_Txt1b: to automatically look up and use the NTP server as provided by DHCP. Click the View button to see the current setting. Note that this will not be available if using a static IP address.
advanced_tcpip_h.nTPmanNTP_Txt: To specify the server manually, check the radio button Use the following NTP server address and enter the server's IP address or host name. Note that a DNS server must be specified if using a host name.
advanced_tcpip_h.hostname_Txt1b: can also be accessed using a host name instead of an IP address. The host name is usually the same as the assigned DNS Name. It is always the first part of a Fully Qualified Domain Name and is always one word, with no period. For example, myserver is the host name in the Fully Qualified Domain Name myserver.axis.com
advanced_tcpip_h.hostname_DHCP1_Txt1a: Obtain Host name via IPv4 DHCP - Checking this radio button causes the
advanced_tcpip_h.hostname_DHCP1_Txt1b: to automatically look up and use the host name as provided by the DHCP server running on IPv4. Click the View button to see the current setting. Note that this will not be available if using a static IP address.
advanced_tcpip_h.hostname_DHCP2_Txt1a: Obtain Host name via DHCP - Checking this radio button causes the
advanced_tcpip_h.hostname_DHCP2_Txt1b: to automatically look up and use the host name as provided by the DHCP server. Click the View button to see the current setting. Note that this will not be available if using a static IP address.
advanced_tcpip_h.usehostname_Txt: Use the host name - This host name will be used to identify the product in internal messages, e.g. log files. See also Obtain host name via DHCP above.
advanced_tcpip_h.enabledynamic_Txt1b: includes support for dynamically updating local DNS servers whenever the product's IP address changes. Check this box to enable the function. The
advanced_tcpip_h.enabledynamic_Txt1c: supports RFC2136: Dynamic Updates in the Domain Name System (DNS UPDATE)
advanced_tcpip_h.enabledynamic_Txt2: Important note! These settings concern the use of local DNS servers and should not be confused with the settings for the Axis Internet Dynamic DNS service.
advanced_tcpip_h.enabledynamic_Txt3a: Register DNS name - The name entered here will be associated with the IP address for the
advanced_tcpip_h.enabledynamic_Txt3b: in the DNS server. An example of a DNS name is Axisproduct.example.com
advanced_tcpip_h.tTL_Txt: TTL (Time To Live) - This value determines how long (in seconds) the reply from the DNS server should be remembered when checking that the domain name for the registered IP address is still valid. This reduces the number of times the client has to query the DNS server, which in turn reduces network usage.
advanced_tcpip_h.link_Txt1a: Auto-Configure Link-Local Address - This is a built-in function that assigns the
advanced_tcpip_h.link_Txt1b: an additional IP address, which can be used to access the unit from other hosts on the same segment of the local network. The
advanced_tcpip_h.link_Txt1c: can have both a Link-Local IP and a static/DHCP-supplied IP address at the same time - these will not affect each other.
advanced_tcpip_h.link_Txt2: To see the current Link-Local settings, click the View button.
advanced_tcpip_h.httpport_Txt1a: HTTP Port - Enter the HTTP port the
advanced_tcpip_h.httpport_Txt1b: will use. The default setting is 80. Alternatively, any port in the range 1024-65535 may be used, but check first with your system administrator before changing the default setting.
advanced_tcpip_h.httpsport_Txt1a: HTTPS Port - Enter the HTTPS port the
advanced_tcpip_h.httpsport_Txt1b: will use. The default setting is 443.
advanced_tcpip_h.nattrav_Txt1b: is located on an intranet (LAN) and you wish to make it available from the other (WAN) side of a NAT router. When this is properly configured, all HTTP traffic to an external HTTP port in the NAT router will be forwarded to the
advanced_tcpip_h.nattrav_Txt2a: Click the Enable button to start NAT configuration, whereby the
advanced_tcpip_h.nattrav_Txt2b: will attempt to configure port mapping in a NAT router on your network, using UPnP™.
advanced_tcpip_h.nattrav_man_Txt1a: Use manually selected NAT router - Check this box to manually select a NAT router and enter the IP address for the router in the field provided. If a router is not manually specified, the
advanced_tcpip_h.nattrav_man_Txt1b: will automatically search for NAT routers on your network. If more than one router is found, the default router will be selected.
advanced_tcpip_h.alt_http_port_Txt: Alternative HTTP port - Select this option to manually define an external HTTP port, and enter the port number in the field provided. If no port is entered, a port number will automatically be selected when NAT traversal is enabled.
advanced_tcpip_h.fTPport_Txt1a: Enable FTP server - The FTP server running in the
advanced_tcpip_h.fTPport_Txt1b: enables the upload of e.g. new firmware, user applications, etc. Check the box to enable the FTP server.
advanced_tcpip_h.fTP_upload_Txt: Note that this option has nothing to do with the unit's ability to transfer images via FTP to other locations/servers.
advanced_tcpip_h.rTSPportaudio_Txt1: Enable RTSP Server - The RTSP protocol allows a connecting client to start an audio stream. Check the box to enable the service.
advanced_tcpip_h.rTSPportaudio_Txt2a: Enter the RTSP port number the
advanced_tcpip_h.rTSPportaudio_Txt2b: will use (ports 554, 1024 and higher). The default setting is 554.
advanced_tcpip_h.rTSPportH264_MPEG_4_Txt1: Enable RTSP Server - The RTSP protocol allows a connecting client to start an H.264 stream. Check the box to enable the service. If this service is not enabled it will not be possible to view H.264 or MPEG-4 video streams.
advanced_tcpip_h.rTSPportH264_MPEG_4_Txt2a: Enter the RTSP port number the
advanced_tcpip_h.rTSPportH264_MPEG_4_Txt2b: will use (ports 554, 1024 and higher). The default setting is 554.
advanced_tcpip_h.rTSPportH264_Txt1: Enable RTSP Server - The RTSP protocol allows a connecting client to start an H.264 stream. Check the box to enable the service. If this service is not enabled it will not be possible to view H.264 video streams.
advanced_tcpip_h.rTSPportH264_Txt2a: Enter the RTSP port number the
advanced_tcpip_h.rTSPportH264_Txt2b: will use (ports 554, 1024 and higher). The default setting is 554.
advanced_tcpip_h.rTSPportMPEG_4_Txt1: Enable RTSP Server - The RTSP protocol allows a connecting client to start an MPEG-4 stream. Check the box to enable the service. If this service is not enabled it will not be possible to view MPEG-4 video streams.
advanced_tcpip_h.rTSPportMPEG_4_Txt2a: Enter the RTSP port number the
advanced_tcpip_h.rTSPportMPEG_4_Txt2b: will use (ports 554, 1024 and higher). The default setting is 554.
advanced_tcpip_h.contype_Txt1a: Connection Type - This can be used to change the network speed for the
advanced_tcpip_h.contype_Txt1b: . Normally, there is no need to use anything other than Auto-negotiate, which automatically selects the correct media type.
advanced_tcpip_h.contype_Txt2: However, if using a switch or similar device on your network and the media type needs to be specified, this can be selected from the drop-down list.
advanced_tcpip_h.maxband_Txt1a: Maximum bandwidth - To minimize the impact on other services running on your network, it is possible to configure the maximum network bandwidth the
advanced_tcpip_h.maxband_Txt2a: Specify, in Mbit/s or kbit/s, the maximum bandwidth allowed, or set to Unlimited. This is a useful function when connecting your
advanced_tcpip_h.maxband_Txt2b: to busy or heavily loaded networks.
advanced_tcpip_h.maxband_warnTxt:
When using MPEG-4 as the video format, remember that setting a maximum bandwidth value here may create problems for individual video streams if the maximum value is less than the sum of the bit rates set for the video streams. See also the MPEG-4 settings and help available from
Setup > Video & Image > Advanced.
advanced_tcpip_h.maxband_minvalueTxt: The lowest value allowed for the maximum bandwidth is 30 kbit/s. Using a lower value will leave the bandwidth unlimited.

tcpip_h.intro1_Txt1b: provides support for IP version 4 and IP version 6. Both versions may be enabled simultaneously, and at least one version must always be enabled.
tcpip_h.intro1_Txt2a: When using IPv4, the IP address for the
tcpip_h.intro1_Txt2b: can be set automatically via DHCP, or a static IP address can be set manually.
tcpip_h.intro1_Txt3b: will receive an IP address according to the configuration in the network router.
tcpip_h.introNotify_Txt1: There are also options for setting up notification of changes in the IP address, and for using the AXIS Internet Dynamic DNS Service.
tcpip_h.introNotify_Txt2: Note that the unit's current IP address can also be discovered by using UPnP.
tcpip_h.introNotify_Txt3: See also the help on the
tcpip_h.intro2_Txt1b: can be set automatically via DHCP, or a static IP address can be set manually.
tcpip_h.introNotifyIPv6_Txt: There are also options for setting up notification of changes in the IP address, and for using the AXIS Internet Dynamic DNS Service.
tcpip_h.introNote_Txt1: Note: The unit's current IP address can also be discovered by using UPnP.
tcpip_h.introNote_Txt2: See also the help on the advanced TCP/IP settings.
tcpip_h.select_current_Txt: To see the current network settings, click the View button.
tcpip_h.select_mode_Txt1b: can be wired or wireless. Different settings can be used for each network interface, but only one can be used at a time. Check the relevant radio button to decide how the different network interfaces will be selected.
tcpip_h.enableIPv4_Txt: Enable IPv4 - Check this box to enable IPv4.
tcpip_h.obtainIP_Txt1: Obtain IP address via DHCP - Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) is a protocol that lets network administrators centrally manage and automate the assignment of IP addresses on a network. DHCP is enabled by default.
tcpip_h.obtainIP_Txt3a: DHCP should only be enabled if using dynamic IP address notification (see below), or if your DHCP server can update a DNS server, which then allows you to access the
tcpip_h.obtainIP_Txt3b: by name (host name). If DHCP is enabled and you cannot access the unit, you may have to reset it to the factory default settings and then perform the installation again.
tcpip_h.obtainIP_Txt4: Although a DHCP server is mostly used to set an IP address dynamically, it is also possible to use it to set a static, known IP address for a particular MAC address.
tcpip_h.obtainIP_Txt5b: to use DHCP servers for obtaining network settings, it may also be possible for a BOOTP server to provide these settings.
tcpip_h.fixedIP_Txt1a: To use a static IP address for the
tcpip_h.fixedIP_Txt1b: , check the radio button for Use the following IP address and then make the following settings:
tcpip_h.fixedIP_Txt2a: IP address - Specify a unique IP address for your
tcpip_h.fixedIP_Txt2b: . (To check if the IP address you intend to use is available or not, click the Test button)
tcpip_h.fixedIP_Txt3a: Subnet mask - Specify the mask for the subnet the
tcpip_h.fixedIP_Txt4: Default router - Specify the IP address of the default router (gateway) used for connecting devices attached to different networks and network segments.
tcpip_h.fixedIP_Txt5: Note - Static IP addresses can be assigned at random within isolated networks, provided that each given address is unique. To avoid conflicts, it is strongly recommended that you contact your network administrator prior to assigning a static IP address.
tcpip_h.iPv6_config_Txt: Check the box for Enable IPv6 to enable IPv6. Other settings for IPv6 are configured in the network router.
tcpip_h.aRPPing_Txt1a: Enable ARP/Ping setting of IP address - The IP address for the
tcpip_h.aRPPing_Txt1b: can be set using the ARP/Ping method, which associates the unit's MAC address with an IP address. Check this box to enable ARP/Ping setting. Leave the service disabled to prevent unintentional resetting of the IP address.
tcpip_h.aRPPing_Txt3: The ARP/Ping service is automatically disabled 2 minutes after the unit is started, or as soon as an IP address is set.
tcpip_h.aRPPing_Txt4: Pinging the unit will still be possible when this service is disabled.
tcpip_h.notification_Txt1a: Options for notification of IP address change. When the IP address for your
tcpip_h.notification_Txt1b: changes, you can choose to be notified of the change. To configure notifications, click the Settings button. More...
tcpip_h.internetDDNS_Txt1: AXIS Internet Dynamic DNS service - The AXIS Internet Dynamic DNS Service can provide your Axis product with its own URL (web address), which can then be used to access it over the Internet. The product can be unregistered from the service at any time.
tcpip_h.internetDDNS_Txt2: Click the Settings button to modify the Internet Dynamic DNS settings. More...
tcpip_h.avhs_Txt: Enable AVHS - AXIS Video Hosting System (AVHS) in conjunction with an AVHS service provides easy and secure Internet access to live and recorded video accessible from any location. For more information and help to find a local AVHS Service Provider please go to www.axis.com. If AVHS is not to be used this option can be disabled.
tcpip_h.avhs_oneClick_Txt: One-click enabled - This option is enabled by default. When the control button is pressed the camera will connect to an AVHS service over the Internet. If the camera is registered to an AVHS service the value will change to Always and the camera will stay connected to the AVHS service. If the camera is not registered within 24 hours from when the control button was pressed, the camera will disconnect from the AVHS service.
tcpip_h.avhs_always_Txt: Always - The Axis product will constantly attempt to connect to an AVHS service over the Internet, once registered the product will stay connected to the AVHS service. This option can be used if the camera is already installed and pressing the control button is not convenient.
tcpip_h.avhs_oneClick2buttons_Txt: One-click enabled - This option is enabled by default. When the control button (button 1) is pressed the camera will connect to an AVHS service over the Internet. If the camera is registered to an AVHS service the value will change to Always and the camera will stay connected to the AVHS service. If the camera is not registered within 24 hours from when the control button was pressed, the camera will disconnect from the AVHS service.
tcpip_h.avhs_always2buttons_Txt: Always - The Axis product will constantly attempt to connect to an AVHS service over the Internet, once registered the product will stay connected to the AVHS service. This option can be used if the camera is already installed and pressing the control button (button 1) is not convenient.
tcpip_h.avhs_proxy_Txt1: Proxy settings - If required, enter the proxy settings to connect to the HTTP server.
tcpip_h.avhs_proxy_Txt3: Proxy port - Enter the number of the port used for access
tcpip_h.avhs_proxy_Txt4: Proxy login - Enter a user name for the proxy server if required
tcpip_h.avhs_proxy_Txt5: Proxy password - Enter a password for the proxy server if required
tcpip_h.avhs_proxy_Txt6: Proxy authentication method - Select one of the options below
tcpip_h.avhs_proxy_Txt7: Basic - The Basic proxy authentication method is the most compatible authentication scheme for HTTP. It is however less secure as it sends the user name and password unencrypted to the server.
tcpip_h.avhs_proxy_Txt8: Digest - The Digest proxy authentication method is more secure than Basic as it always transfers the password across the network encrypted.
tcpip_h.avhs_proxy_Txt9b: to select the authentication method automatically depending on the methods supported. It prioritizes the Digest method over the Basic method.
tcpip_h.IPv6_config_Txt: Check the box for Enable IPv6 to enable IPv6. Other settings for IPv6 are configured in the network router.
tcpip_h.tcpip_help_enableIPv4New_Txt: Enable IPv4 - Check this box to enable IPv4.
tcpip_h.IPv6_help_Txt: Check the box for Enable IPv6 to enable IPv6. Other settings for IPv6 are configured in the network router.
tcpip_h.tcpip_help_InternetDDNS_Txt1: AXIS Internet Dynamic DNS service - The AXIS Internet Dynamic DNS Service can provide your Axis product with its own URL (web address), which can then be used to access it over the Internet. The product can be unregistered from the service at any time.
tcpip_h.tcpip_help_InternetDDNS_Txt2: Click the Settings button to modify the Internet Dynamic DNS settings.
tcpip_h.tcpip_help_obtainIPDhcp_Txt1: Obtain IP address via DHCP - Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) is a protocol that lets network administrators centrally manage and automate the assignment of IP addresses on a network. DHCP is enabled by default.
tcpip_h.tcpip_help_obtainIPDhcp_Txt3: DHCP should only be enabled if using dynamic IP address notification (see below), or if your DHCP server can update a DNS server, which then allows you to access the
tcpip_h.tcpip_help_obtainIPDhcp_Txt4: by name (host name). If DHCP is enabled and you cannot access the unit, you may have to reset it to the factory default settings and then perform the installation again.
tcpip_h.tcpip_help_obtainIPDhcp_Txt5: Although a DHCP server is mostly used to set an IP address dynamically, it is also possible to use it to set a static, known IP address for a particular MAC address.
tcpip_h.tcpip_help_obtainIPDhcp_Txt7: to use DHCP servers for obtaining network settings, it may also be possible for a BOOTP server to provide these settings.
tcpip_h.tcpip_help_fixedIPStatic_Txt1: To use a static IP address for the
tcpip_h.tcpip_help_fixedIPStatic_Txt2: , check the radio button for Use the following IP address and then make the following settings:
tcpip_h.tcpip_help_fixedIPStatic_Txt3: IP address - Specify a unique IP address for your
tcpip_h.tcpip_help_fixedIPStatic_Txt4: . (To check if the IP address you intend to use is available or not, click the Test button)
tcpip_h.tcpip_help_fixedIPStatic_Txt5: Subnet mask - Specify the mask for the subnet the
tcpip_h.tcpip_help_fixedIPStatic_Txt7: Default router - Specify the IP address of the default router (gateway) used for connecting devices attached to different networks and network segments.
tcpip_h.tcpip_help_fixedIPStatic_Txt8: Note - Static IP addresses can be assigned at random within isolated networks, provided that each given address is unique. To avoid conflicts, it is strongly recommended that you contact your network administrator prior to assigning a static IP address.

internetDyn_DNS_h.helpInfo1Txt1a: Use the AXIS Internet Dynamic DNS service to assign a host name for easy access to your
internetDyn_DNS_h.help4aTxt1a: Register or update current domain name registration - If your
internetDyn_DNS_h.help4aTxt1b: has not previously been registered at the AXIS Internet Dynamic DNS Service, clicking the Register button will start the registration process. You will then need to visit
internetDyn_DNS_h.help4aTxt1c: to complete the process. This must be done within 60 minutes of clicking the button.
internetDyn_DNS_h.help4aTxt2b: is already registered at the AXIS Internet Dynamic DNS Service, clicking this button will simply update the registration information.
internetDyn_DNS_h.help5aTxt1a: Remove currently registered domain name - Click to remove the currently registered domain name for your
internetDyn_DNS_h.help1aTxt1a: Enable automatic updates to the AXIS Internet Dynamic DNS service - If your
internetDyn_DNS_h.help1aTxt1b: has been registered at the AXIS Internet Dynamic DNS Service and its IP address changes, the DNS service must be updated with this new IP address.
internetDyn_DNS_h.help1cTxt1b: is connected to the Internet via a NAT (network address translation) device and this device's IP address changes, the AXIS Internet Dynamic DNS Service will automatically be updated with the new IP address.
internetDyn_DNS_h.help1eTxt: Check this box to enable automatic updates.
internetDyn_DNS_h.help2aTxt: Enable regular updates to the AXIS Internet Dynamic DNS Service - Check this box to enable regular updates to the AXIS Internet Dynamic DNS service. These regular updates will always occur at the set interval, with no regard to whether automatic updates have been configured or not. Both update methods may be enabled simultaneously.
internetDyn_DNS_h.help2bTxt: Interval in hours between updates - Set the interval at which to regularly update the AXIS Internet Dynamic DNS Service.
internetDyn_DNS_h.help3aTxt1a: Disable registration/update via the control button - Check this box to disable the use of the control button for performing registration/updates of the
internetDyn_DNS_h.help3aTxt1b: 's IP address at the AXIS Internet Dynamic DNS Service.

notification_h.help1Txt1a: When the IP Address for the
notification_h.help1Txt1b: changes, you can choose to be notified of the change via HTTP, FTP or SMTP. Provide the
notification_h.help1Txt1c: with the means with which you want to be notified (e.g. set up an FTP server), and click the OK button to implement these settings.
notification_h.help1Txt2: Note that all three options may be used simultaneously, if required.
notification_h.help4Txt1a: When this option is selected, the
notification_h.help4Txt1b: sends an HTTP GET request to the specified URL. This can then easily be taken care of by a designated cgi-script, which registers the request. The format of the GET request is as follows:
notification_h.help4Txt3: Check the Enable box and provide the following information for HTTP notification:
notification_h.help5Txt1: URL - The URL to the cgi-script that will handle the information.
notification_h.help5Txt2: Custom Parameters - Additional parameters, such as your own text. Note: This string must be URL-encoded and supplied with a leading & character (ampersand).
notification_h.help5Txt3: User Name and Password - If the script is password protected, then these fields must be completed.
notification_h.help5Txt4: Proxy address/Proxy Port - If you must pass a proxy server to connect to the host in the URL, then enter the proxy server's address and port in this field.
notification_h.help5Txt5: Proxy User Name and Password - If you need to supply a user name and password to your proxy server, enter them here.
notification_h.help6aTxt: Click the Test button to test the connection to the HTTP server.
notification_h.help6Txt: The SMTP option will send notification by email. Note that a mail server must be configured under the SMTP settings. Check the Enable box and provide the following information for SMTP notification:
notification_h.help7Txt1: Send to - Specify the recipient's email address here. Multiple recipients may be entered by separating them by semicolons or commas. Mailing list addresses may also be used, but check that the mailing list is present on the mail server.
notification_h.help7Txt2: Subject - Text entered here will be shown in the subject field of the notification.
notification_h.help7aTxt: Test - click this button to send a test email message, to check that the email address is valid and that a mail server has been correctly configured.
notification_h.help8Txt: FTP notification will save a file on the specified FTP server. Check the Enable box and provide the following information for FTP notification:
notification_h.help9Txt1: Network address - Specify the IP address or host name of the target FTP server.
notification_h.help9Txt2: Upload Path - Enter a path name defining where the notification file will be saved on the target server. For example: myserver/notification/
notification_h.help9Txt3: User Name & Password - Enter the user name and password for logging onto the remote FTP host where you will be saving your notification file.
notification_h.help9Txt4: Note: Your System or Network Administrator will normally determine the user access rights and security settings for an FTP host on your network.
notification_h.help9Txt5a: Use Passive Mode - Under normal circumstances the
notification_h.help9Txt5b: simply requests the target FTP server to open the data connection. Checking this box issues a PASV command to the FTP server and establishes a passive FTP connection; whereby the
notification_h.help9Txt5c: actively initiates both the FTP control and data connections to the target server. This is normally desirable if there is a firewall between the
notification_h.help9Txt6: Text Type - When sending the notification file via FTP it is possible to send one of three different types of files:
notification_h.help9Txt7: Short (one line containing only the IP address)
notification_h.help9Txt8: Extended (a multi-line text file containing more information)
notification_h.help9Txt9: Extended HTML, which contains the same information as the Extended file, but with HTML tags added.
notification_h.test_FTP_help_Txt: Click the Test button to test the connection to the FTP server.
notification_h.help13Txt: Enter your own text in the field provided. This text is then used by all of the notification methods described above.

proxy_h.enable_h_Txt: Enable - Check this box to enable using the HTTP proxy server.
proxy_h.server_Txt: Server - Enter a hostname or an IP address of the HTTP proxy to use preceeded by http://. Enclose IPv6 addresses using '[' ']'.
proxy_h.port_Txt: Port - Specify the port to use. Default is 8080.
proxy_h.local_networks_Txt: Local networks - Enter local network IP addresses with subnet mask. Separate multiple networks using ','
proxy_h.access_Txt: Enter the User name and Password for the proxy server.
